question: Will Trump Media & Technology Group (the owner of Truth Social) stock continuously remain below its all-time high until March 31, 2025?
description: Wall Street Journal: [DJT Stock Falls After Trump Moves $4 Billion-Plus Stake Into Trust](https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/stock-market-today-dow-sp500-nasdaq-live-12-20-2024/card/trump-media-stock-falls-after-president-elect-moves-stake-into-trust-bWraJMknSzSH3CbRfibv)
fine_print: In case of forward or reverse stock splits, the price will be adjusted and resolved accordingly, based on comparison to the all-time high.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Trump Media & Technology Group Reports Significant Loss, Plans Expansion**
Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) reported a net loss of $400.86 million in 2024, a significant increase from the previous year's net loss of $58.19 million. The company's revenue was only $3.6 million, mainly due to initial advertising initiatives and testing of monetization projects with partners. Despite the financial struggles, TMTG plans to expand its platforms, including Truth Social, Truth+, and Truth.Fi, and is exploring partnerships, mergers, and acquisitions. CEO Devin Nunes stated, 'We have developed quickly since our IPO and listing on the NASDAQ last year, and this year we aim to further expand our platforms.' The company has a cash reserve of $776.8 million, which will enable it to continue its strategic initiatives and expansion plans.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 17, 2025 06:48 PM
Source:[finanzen.net](https://www.finanzen.net/nachricht/aktien/jahresbilanz-trump-media-aktie-gelassen-tmtg-steckt-tief-in-den-roten-zahlen-dennoch-strategische-expansion-geplant-14246495)

**Trump Media Reports $400.9 Million Net Loss for 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of social media platform Truth Social, reported a net loss of $400.9 million for 2024. The loss is accompanied by a 12% decrease in annual revenue, which now stands at $3.6 million, attributed to an undisclosed advertising partner. Unlike Meta and other social media companies, Trump Media's management stated in the report that they do not believe in using traditional metrics such as active users or average revenue per user. This 'could potentially divert attention from the strategic evaluation of the company's progress and growth', according to the report. The company's stock price fell by around 1% in extended trading on Friday after the operator of Truth Social published its results for 2024. Trump Media has been criticized for its lack of transparency in its financial reporting, and its decision not to hold a conference call to discuss the results. The company has also been accused of using its platform to promote its own financial interests, including the launch of a new fintech service called Truth.Fi, which will offer cryptocurrency and ETF investments. Trump Media has placed $250 million (approximately one-third of its liquid assets) under the supervision of Charles Schwab Corp. to be invested in funds, bitcoin, and other financial vehicles. The company's financial situation has raised concerns about its viability and ability to compete with larger social media companies like Meta and X (formerly Twitter).
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 17, 2025 12:18 PM
Source:[developpez.com](https://web.developpez.com/actu/369208/Trump-Media-affiche-une-perte-colossale-de-plus-de-400-millions-de-dollars-en-2024-et-12-pourcent-de-revenus-en-moins-soit-3-6-millions-de-dollars-L-entreprise-refuse-de-communiquer-les-metriques-traditionnelles/)

**Trump Media & Technology Group Reports Significant Losses in 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) reported a net loss of $400.86 million in 2024, a significant increase from the previous year's net loss of $58.19 million. The company's revenue was only $3.6 million, with most of it coming from initial advertising initiatives and testing of monetization projects with partners. Despite the losses, TMTG has a cash reserve of $776.8 million and plans to expand its platforms Truth Social, Truth+, and Truth.Fi. The company aims to become a holding company with subsidiaries in various industries and is exploring partnerships, mergers, and acquisitions. TMTG CEO Devin Nunes stated, 'We have developed quickly since our IPO and NASDAQ listing last year, and this year we are striving to further expand all our platforms.' The company's stock price decreased by 0.91% on Friday, closing at $30.39.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 17, 2025 09:37 AM
Source:[finanzen.net](https://www.finanzen.net/nachricht/aktien/jahresbilanz-trump-media-aktie-gelassen-tmtg-steckt-tief-in-den-roten-zahlen-dennoch-strategische-expansion-geplant-14246495)

**Trump Media & Technology Group Pays Out $170 Million in Stock Compensation Despite Significant Losses**
Despite a significant increase in losses, Trump Media & Technology Group has paid out approximately $170 million in stock compensation to its employees. The company, which operates Truth Social, a social media platform founded by former US President Donald Trump, reported a net loss of $410 million in 2023, a 12% decrease from the previous year. The company's cumulative loss has reached $2.9 billion. Trump Media & Technology Group was formed in March 2023 through the merger of Digital World Acquisition and Truth Social. The company's largest shareholder is Trump, whose stake is managed by a trust controlled by his son, Donald Trump Jr. Despite the significant losses, the company's stock price has been fluctuating, often unrelated to its financial performance. Trump's stake in the company is valued at $3.5 billion as of February 14, 2025.
Original language: ja
Publish date: February 17, 2025 07:16 AM
Source:[Bloomberg.com](https://www.bloomberg.co.jp/news/articles/2025-02-17/SRSQK7T1UM0W00)

**Trump Media Reports Record Net Loss of $400.9 Million**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the company behind the social media platform Truth Social, reported a record net loss of $400.9 million for 2024, seven times more than the previous year's loss of $58.2 million. According to the company's financial report, the decline in sales by 12% to $3.6 million was due to a revised agreement with a advertising partner. The company also cited legal costs related to the merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp., which was 'blocked by the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Biden administration.' Despite a 11% drop in stock value since the start of 2025, Trump Media's shares rose in 2024 due to Donald Trump's presidential campaign activity. Analysts note that the high volatility of the stock is due to Trump's political status, rather than the company's fundamental business performance.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 16, 2025 09:43 PM
Source:[������.Ru](https://www.gazeta.ru/politics/news/2025/02/17/25102214.shtml)

**Trump Media Reports Record Net Loss of $400.9 Million**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the company behind social media platform Truth Social, reported a record net loss of $400.9 million for 2024, seven times more than the previous year's loss of $58.2 million. According to the company's financial report, the decline in performance was due to legal costs related to the merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp., which was 'blocked by the Biden administration's Securities and Exchange Commission.' Additionally, a 12% decline in sales ($3.6 million) was attributed to a revised agreement with a advertising partner. Trump Media has not disclosed key metrics such as monthly audience and revenue per user, citing the risk of 'distracting from strategic development.' Despite a 2024 stock price increase due to Donald Trump's pre-election activity, the shares have fallen 11% since the start of 2025. Following the release of the report, the stock price dropped an additional 1%. Analysts note that the high volatility of the stock is related to Trump's political status, rather than fundamental business indicators. In May last year, it was reported that Truth Social, Donald Trump's social media platform, had reported multimillion-dollar losses. For the first quarter, Truth Social reported a loss of $327.6 million.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 16, 2025 09:29 PM
Source:[Рамблер/финансы](https://finance.rambler.ru/business/54213455-trump-media-zavershila-god-s-ubytkom-v-400-mln/)

**Trump Media lost over USD400 million last year**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, reported a loss of USD400.9 million last year. The company's annual revenue declined 12% to USD3.6 million, partly due to a revenue-sharing agreement with an undisclosed advertising partner. The losses come despite Donald Trump transferring his shares, worth around USD4 billion, to the Donald J Trump Revocable Trust in December. The company cited its 'early development stage' as a reason for not reporting traditional key performance indicators, such as user sign-ups. As Truth Social's creator, Donald Trump said, 'It was a great day' when he launched the platform after being banned from Twitter and Facebook following the January 6, 2021, Capitol riot.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 16, 2025 09:10 PM
Source:[Borneo Bulletin Online](https://borneobulletin.com.bn/trump-media-lost-over-usd400-million-last-year/)

**Truth Social's Parent Company Lost More Than $400 Million in 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, lost more than $400 million in 2024. The company's annual revenue was $3.6 million, a 12% decline from 2023. CEO Devin Nunes attributed the losses to 'obstruction' by the Biden-era Securities and Exchange Commission over the company's merger with Digital World Acquisition Corp. and a revenue-sharing agreement with an unnamed advertising partner. Trump Media also moved $4 billion worth of shares to a revocable trust, with Donald Trump Jr. as the sole trustee.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 16, 2025 07:40 PM
Source:[The Daily Beast](https://www.thedailybeast.com/truth-socials-parent-company-lost-more-than-400-million-in-2024/)

**Trump Media & Technology Group Reports Significant Losses**
The Trump Media & Technology Group reported a net loss of $401 million, up from $62 million in the previous year, due to a $107 million stock grant to employees. The company's revenue decreased by 12% to $3.6 million, and its annual loss increased by more than six times, bringing the company's accumulated deficit to $2.9 billion. Trump's stake in the company, which operates the social media platform Truth Social, is valued at $3.5 billion. The company ended 2024 with 29 full-time employees, according to the annual report. The company's CEO, reportedly, said, 'The results are a testament to the company's commitment to its employees and its vision for the future.'
Original language: ar
Publish date: February 16, 2025 06:40 PM
Source:[elaosboa.com](https://www.elaosboa.com/2081749/)

**Trump Media Reports $400.9 Million Loss in 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, reported a loss of $400.9 million in 2024 and stated that its annual revenue fell 12%, reaching $3.6 million. The company attributed the losses to a distribution agreement with an unnamed advertising partner. After winning the US presidential election in November, Donald Trump transferred his shares, valued at around $4 billion, to a revocable trust in December, citing a 'good faith donation'. Donald Trump Jr. is the sole trustee and has exclusive voting and investment power over the trust's assets. Trump created Truth Social after being banned from Twitter and Facebook following the January 6, 2021 Capitol riot. Trump Media began trading on the stock exchange in March after merging with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC), Digital World Acquisition Corp. The company does not report traditional key performance indicators, such as user registration, daily or monthly usage, or ad views, citing its 'early development stage'.

**Trump Media Reports $400.9 Million Loss in 2024**
Truth Social, the social media platform created by Donald Trump after being banned from Twitter and Facebook in 2021, has reported a loss of $400.9 million in 2024. The company's annual revenue decreased by 12% to $3.6 million. According to Trump Media & Technology Group, the losses are partly due to a revenue-sharing agreement with an undisclosed advertising partner. Donald Trump transferred his shares, worth around $4 billion, to the Donald J. Trump Revocable Trust in December, after winning the US presidential election. His son, Donald Trump Jr., is the sole trustee of the group and has exclusive voting and investment power over its shares. Truth Social does not disclose traditional key performance indicators, such as the number of registered users, daily, monthly, or ad views. The company went public in March 2024 after merging with Digital World Acquisition Corp., a special purpose acquisition company that allows young businesses to list their shares on the stock exchange more quickly and easily.

**Trump Media Reports Massive Losses and Revenue Decline in 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, reported losses of $400.9 million in 2024, along with a 12% decrease in annual revenue, reaching only $3.6 million. According to the financial reports, part of the losses are related to a distribution agreement with an unidentified advertising partner. The reports also indicate that Donald Trump transferred his shares, valued at $4 billion, to his Revocable Trust in December 2024, with his son Donald Trump Jr. as the sole trustee and controller of the associated investments. Truth Social, created by Trump after being banned from Twitter and Facebook in 2021, is still in its early development stage and has not provided metrics on user numbers or ad views. The company went public in March 2024 after merging with Digital World Acquisition Corp., a SPAC that facilitates the entry of emerging companies into the stock market without a traditional IPO process. The financial losses of Trump Media raise doubts about the future of Truth Social in a competitive market where social media platforms fiercely compete for users and advertisers.

**Trump Media Reports Over $400 Million Loss in 2024**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of the social media platform Truth Social, reported a loss of $400.9 million in 2024 and a 12% decline in annual revenue, reaching $3.6 million. The financial reports, published on Friday night, indicate that part of the losses are attributed to a distribution agreement with an unidentified advertising partner. In December 2024, Donald Trump transferred his shares, valued at an estimated $4 billion, to the Donald J. Trump Revocable Trust, with Donald Trump Jr. as the sole trustee and having exclusive control over voting and investment decisions related to these assets. Truth Social was created by Trump after he was banned from Twitter and Facebook following the January 6, 2021, events at the US Capitol. **Trump Media Awards Employees $107 Million in Stock Despite $401 Million Losses**
Despite losses, Trump Media & Technology Group Corp awarded its employees with over 107 million dollars in stock last year. The company, which operates the Truth Social platform, ended the year with 29 full-time employees, according to its annual report released after the market closed on Friday. The company's revenue decreased by over 12% to $3.6 million, while its annual losses increased by more than six times. This led to an increase in the cumulative deficit of the project to $2.9 billion. The company was founded through a merger with a special purpose acquisition company in March, and former President Donald Trump is its largest shareholder, with his stake held in a trust managed by his son Donald Trump Jr. Despite the losses, the company's stock is traded like a meme stock, moving independently of the company's financial results. The company used $61 million in cash for its operational activities, while the majority of the net losses came from a change in the value of financial derivatives. As Trump, the 45th President of the United States, successfully ran his campaign to regain the White House, the company's stock price almost doubled last year.

**Trump Media & Technology Group (NASDAQ:DJT) Shares Gap Down   - Here's What Happened**
Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ:DJT) gapped down on Tuesday, opening at $37.59 after previously closing at $40.03. The company's stock last traded at $34.65 with a volume of 9,186,814 shares. Trump Media & Technology Group has a quick ratio of 47.49, a current ratio of 47.49, and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.01. Insiders have sold a total of 536,100 shares of company stock valued at $16,274,894 over the last quarter. Institutional investors own 4.29% of the company's stock. The company's social media platform, Truth Social, offers social networking services in the United States. MarketBeat's editorial team recommends considering other stocks before investing in Trump Media & Technology Group.

**Trump Media Stock Drops 10% to Kick Off the New Administration**
Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT), the parent company of Truth Social, dropped 10% to $36 in the first hours of President Donald Trump's new administration. Despite being up for the year, the stock has fallen from its January highs above $40 and pre-election highs above $50. Analysts at VandaTrack warned of a 'sell-the-news flow action' following the inauguration, which could lead to a slide in the stock accompanied by strong retail buying. Trump Media's market value is nearing $8 billion, making it a significant player in the market despite its relatively small size.

Publish date: January 21, 2025 06:24 PM
Source:[Yahoo! Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/trump-media-stock-drops-10-173900292.html)

**Trump Media & Technology Stock Sees 16% Intra-Day Surge Ahead of Trump's Inauguration**
Trump Media & Technology Group's stock experienced a significant intra-day increase of 16% on Monday, the largest since November 18. This surge comes ahead of Donald Trump's inauguration, scheduled for later this month. The company, parent of Truth Social, had seen a steady decline in its stock value in mid-2024, but rebounded during the final stages of the 2024 US presidential election. Over the past 12 months, the company's stock has seen a substantial rally, with a gain of approximately 80%. This stock price increase marks a significant turnaround for the company, which faced difficulties in the middle of 2024.
Original language: fr
Publish date: January 13, 2025 04:54 PM
Source:[Investing.com France](https://fr.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/les-actions-de-trump-media--technology-enregistrent-une-croissance-intrajournaliere-de-16-93CH-2706386)

**What's Going On With Trump Media & Technology Group Stock On Tuesday? (CORRECTED) - Trump Media & Technology (NASDAQ:DJT)**
A New York judge has ruled that Donald Trump will be sentenced on January 10, 2025, for his conviction in the hush-money case. Trump was found guilty of 34 felony counts of falsifying business records in May 2024. The case relates to a $130,000 payment made during the 2016 election cycle. Trump faces an unconditional discharge, meaning no prison, fines, or probation, but the conviction will remain on his record. Trump Media & Technology Group Corp (DJT) stock is trading lower on Tuesday, down 2.68% at $35.21, following the sentencing decision. Despite the dip, the stock has surged 104% in the last 12 months. Trump Media reported third-quarter net sales of $1.01 million, a 6% decline year-on-year, with advertising on the Truth Social platform accounting for the company's total revenue. 'The need for finality in the case' was cited by Judge Juan Merchan as the reason for denying Trump's request for a stay of the proceedings, according to BBC News.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 07, 2025 10:07 PM
Source:[Benzinga](https://www.benzinga.com/news/legal/25/01/42859160/whats-going-on-with-trump-media-technology-group-stock-on-tuesday-5)

**Where Will Trump Media Stock Be in 1 Year?**
Trump Media & Technology Group (NASDAQ: DJT), the parent company of Truth Social, has seen its stock price fluctuate wildly since its public listing on March 26, 2024. Despite generating only $4.1 million in revenue in 2023 and a net loss of $58.2 million, the company's market cap has reached $7.4 billion, a staggering 1,850 times last year's revenue. Analysts believe that the stock is being driven by short-term traders, supporters of President-elect Donald Trump, and speculative investors who think the company can expand into a major social and streaming media platform. However, with Trump recently transferring his shares into a revocable trust, some investors are concerned about potential stock sales in the future. The author predicts that the stock will remain volatile over the next 12 months, but ultimately experience a deep drawdown, potentially losing more than 90% of its value.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 02, 2025 12:30 PM
Source:[NASDAQ Stock Market](https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/where-will-trump-media-stock-be-1-year)

**Where Will Trump Media Stock Be in 1 Year? | The Motley Fool**
Trump Media & Technology Group, the parent company of Truth Social, has been a volatile investment since its public listing on March 26, 2024. Despite its market cap of $7.4 billion, the company has generated only $4.1 million in revenue in 2023 and $2.6 million in the first nine months of 2024, with a net loss of $58.2 million and $363.2 million, respectively. The company's cash reserves are dwindling, and its expansion into a streaming video platform is expected to burn through its cash at an even faster rate. Analysts believe that the stock will remain volatile over the next 12 months, but expect the election-driven euphoria to dissipate, leading to a deep drawdown in the stock's value, potentially losing more than 90% of its value. 'It might seem shocking that Trump Media still has a market cap of $7.4 billion -- a staggering 1,850 times last year's revenue,' said the analyst. 'So for now, it looks like a meme stock which is being mainly driven by the political headlines instead of any fundamental improvements to its business.'
Original language: en
Publish date: January 02, 2025 12:29 PM
Source:[The Motley Fool](https://www.fool.com/investing/2025/01/02/where-will-trump-media-stock-be-in-1-year/)

**Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ:DJTWW) Short Interest Update**
Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. (NASDAQ:DJTWW) saw a significant drop in short interest in December, with 24,200 shares shorted as of December 15th, a 16.6% decrease from the November 30th total of 29,000 shares. The days-to-cover ratio is 0.0 days, based on an average trading volume of 742,900 shares. The stock price dropped $0.52 on Friday, closing at $24.98 with a trading volume of 82,568 shares. The company's 12-month low is $5.01 and high is $44.83. Trump Media & Technology Group develops the social media platform Truth Social, offering social networking services in the US.

Source:[dakotafinancialnews.com](https://dakotafinancialnews.com/2024/12/30/trump-media-technology-group-corp-nasdaqdjtww-short-interest-update.html)

forecasters.initial_reasoning: To determine the probability that Trump Media & Technology Group stock remains below its all-time high until March 31, 2025, we can start by examining typical stock recovery patterns. Research indicates that a majority of stocks do not exceed their all-time highs within short periods after substantial value decreases. Historical analysis suggests that approximately 70% of stocks remain below their peak for extended timeframes beyond a year following a downturn.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Volatility
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The technology and media sectors are subject to substantial market volatility, which can impede a stock's ability to appreciate rapidly and exceed previous all-time highs.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Fundamental Business Performance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given the scrutiny of Trump Media's business operations and revenue model, maintaining strong and consistent financial performance is crucial for investor confidence. Any underperformance can prevent a rise above all-time highs.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Regulatory and Political Risks
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Trump Media is subject to regulatory and political risks, particularly due to potential controversies surrounding its affiliations and business practices. These risks can further delay recovery to all-time highs.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competition in the Social Media Space
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Strong competition from established social media platforms hampers Trump Media’s growth prospects, making it more challenging to reach new all-time highs in the short term.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The significant net loss of $400.9 million reported by Trump Media for 2024 emphasizes the company's financial struggles, further hampering its stock's potential to recover to all-time highs. The 12% decrease in annual revenue and criticism over a lack of transparency in financial reporting reinforce concerns about the company's business fundamentals. The high stock volatility, largely influenced by political factors rather than business performance, supports the expectation that the stock will remain below its all-time high.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Trump Media's planned expansion and significant cash reserves of $776.8 million could suggest potential future growth and investment into their platforms, which may positively affect company performance. However, these plans remain speculative and contingent on successful execution amid existing financial challenges.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, stock prices returning to their all-time highs, especially after a decline, can be unlikely to happen quickly. This applies even more if the stock is from a company facing unique challenges or is subject to significant public and political scrutiny, as Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) likely does. Assuming a typical tech-related stock's base rate, such as a 30% chance of returning to its all-time high within a short term without outstanding positive catalyzing events, is reasonable.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Political and Public Sentiment
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given TMTG's association with a highly polarizing figure, shifts in political climate and public sentiment can affect stock performance negatively. The controversy could maintain pressure on the stock price by discouraging potential investors, thus sustaining it below its all-time high.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Platform Adoption and Performance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Truth Social's user growth and engagement metrics must show substantial improvement to act as a catalyst for stock improvement. Without significant positive change in platform performance, investor confidence remains low, reducing the likelihood of stock price reaching previous highs.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Competition and Challenges
